result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tremond Devonn Walker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tremond Devonn Walker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kylan Reilly in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant is eligible for SPD services; SPD has not appointed Attorney. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of counsel in Branch PE. Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no contact with NSB (DOB: 05/31/1998); ADW (DOB: 11/29/2019). No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tremond Devonn Walker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Hotchkiss appeared by video for Tremond Devonn Walker.  Attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2-3.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
